recipe_xml:
<recipe>
  <title>Pasta with Lentil Bolognese</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 small onion</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 small carrot</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 stalk celery</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 garlic cloves</ingredient>
    <ingredient>minced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 teaspoons tomato paste'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 (16-ounce) cans whole peeled plum tomatoes</ingredient>
    <ingredient>drained and roughly chopped (juice reserved)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/4 cups dried French green lentils'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Coarse sea or kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 pound shaped pasta</ingredient>
    <ingredient>such as cavatappi</ingredient>
    <ingredient>rigatoni</ingredient>
    <ingredient>or ziti'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Pecorino cheese</ingredient>
    <ingredient>grated or shaved'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Fresh basil</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chopped (optional)']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. In a large pot over medium heat, warm the olive oil. Add the onion, carrot, celery, and garlic and cook slowly until the vegetables soften and turn golden, about 20 minutes.</step>
    <step>2. Increase heat to medium-high and add the tomato paste. Cook until the mixture dries out a bit, about 3 minutes. Pour in the reserved juice from the tomatoes and cook, scraping the browned bits from the bottom of the pan, until the liquid has reduced by half, 1 to 2 minutes.</step>
    <step>3. Stir in the lentils, tomatoes, and 1 cup water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat. Season with the salt and pepper and simmer until the lentils are tender, 30 minutes to 1 hour, depending on the lentils. (If the sauce begins to dry out, add additional water as needed.) Reduce heat to low and keep warm.</step>
    <step>4. Cook the pasta according to the package directions</step>
    <step>5. drain. Serve with the lentil sauce, sprinkle with the pecorino, and garnish with the basil, if desired.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Chioggia Beets with Raspberry Mint Vinaigrette</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 lb beets (4 to 6; preferably Chioggia*)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>1 inch of stems left intact'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons thinly sliced scallions'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 to 2 1/2 tablespoons raspberry vinegar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice</ingredient>
    <ingredient>or to taste'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons chopped fresh mint'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon finely grated fresh orange zest (from 2 oranges)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup olive oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'garnish: fresh mint sprigs']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Cover beets with water by 1 inch in a 2- to 3-quart saucepan and simmer until tender when pierced in center with a fork, about 30 minutes. Drain in a colander and rinse under cold running water. Let stand until cool enough to handle, then slip off and discard skins. Cut beets into 1/4-inch-thick slices.</step>
    <step>2. While beets are cooking, stir together scallions, 2 tablespoons vinegar, lemon juice to taste, mint, zest, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Add oil in a slow stream, whisking until combined. Add warm beets and toss with vinaigrette and vinegar and salt to taste. Serve warm or slightly chilled.</step>
    <step>3. *Sometimes called candy-cane beets, chioggias become more aggressive in flavor as they age, so search out relatively young beets, with a diameter of 1 1/2 to 2 inches.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Berry and Ricotta Slice</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['400g ricotta'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'125g reduced-fat cream cheese'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 eggs'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup (60ml) lemon juice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons vanilla extract'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon rice flour'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup (110g) caster (superfine) sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Fresh berries</ingredient>
    <ingredient>to serve']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Preheat oven to 160°C (325°F). Place the ricotta, cream cheese, egg, lemon juice, vanilla, rice flour and sugar in a food processor and process until smooth. Spoon the mixture into a 20cm x 30cm slice tin lined with non-stick baking paper. Bake for 20 minutes or until firm. Refrigerate until cold. Top with fresh berries to serve.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Blade Steaks with Lemon Herb Sauce</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 1/2 pounds top blade beef chuck steaks (1/2 to 1 inch thick)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3/4 teaspoon salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'5 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons coarsely chopped fresh oregano'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons coarsely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon grated fresh lemon zest'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon chopped garlic (1 clove)']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Pat steaks dry and cut 3 slits (1 inch long and 1/4 inch deep) 1 inch apart across center cartilage of each steak (to keep from curling), then sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.</step>
    <step>2. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then cook steaks, turning over once, until meat is just medium-rare, 4 to 7 minutes total.</step>
    <step>3. While steaks cook, pulse herbs with zest, lemon juice, garlic, and remaining 1/4 cup oil, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a food processor until finely chopped.</step>
    <step>4. Transfer steaks to a platter and let stand, loosely covered with foil, 5 minutes, then serve with sauce.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Potato and Pea Salad with Chive Aïoli</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['3 pounds small red-skinned new potatoes</ingredient>
    <ingredient>unpeeled'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons white wine vinegar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 celery stalks</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thinly sliced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 cups frozen green peas</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thawed'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup mayonnaise'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 tablespoons chopped fresh chives'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon Dijon mustard'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 garlic cloves</ingredient>
    <ingredient>pressed'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Cook potatoes in large pot of boiling salted water until just tender, about 25 minutes. Drain</step>
    <step>2. cool. Cut potatoes into quarters. Transfer to large bowl</step>
    <step>3. add vinegar and toss to coat. Mix in celery and peas.</step>
    <step>4. Whisk mayonnaise, 5 tablespoons chives, mustard, garlic, and cayenne pepper in small bowl to blend. Add to potato mixture and toss. Season generously with salt and pepper. Cover and chill at least 1 hour to allow flavors to blend. (Can be made 1 day ahead. Keep refrigerated.) Sprinkle with remaining 1 tablespoon chives and serve.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Parsley, Celery Leaf, and Jicama Salad</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 tablespoons rice vinegar (not seasoned)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 tablespoons sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3/4 teaspoon kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons olive oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3/4 pound jicama</ingredient>
    <ingredient>peeled and cut into thin matchsticks'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 cups flat-leaf parsley leaves (from 2 bunches)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 cups celery leaves (from about 2 bunches)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 scallions</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thinly sliced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 cups radish sprouts (from a 3-ounces package)']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Whisk together lemon juice, vinegar, sugar, and kosher salt in a large bowl until sugar and salt have dissolved, then whisk in oil until well blended.</step>
    <step>2. Add jicama, parsley and celery leaves, scallions, and sprouts and toss to coat. Serve immediately.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Mustard-Crusted Boneless Prime Rib Roast with Cream Sauce</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 (6-pound) boneless prime rib roast</ingredient>
    <ingredient>trimmed</ingredient>
    <ingredient>tied'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 tablespoons store-bought or homemade Montreal-style steak seasoning</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup sour cream'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup prepared horseradish'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup Dijon mustard</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup (1/2 stick) melted unsalted butter']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Season roast all over with 2 Tbsp. steak seasoning. Transfer to a wire rack set inside a rimmed baking sheet and let sit at room temperature 1 hour.</step>
    <step>2. Preheat oven to 225°F. Roast beef until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center registers 120°F, 3 1/2–4 hours (start checking every 5–10 minutes after 3 1/2 hours). Tent with foil and let sit at least 30 minutes and up to 1 hour. Increase oven temperature to 500°F.</step>
    <step>3. Meanwhile, whisk sour cream, horseradish, pepper, salt, and 1/4 cup mustard in a small bowl</step>
    <step>4. set aside.</step>
    <step>5. Remove string from roast</step>
    <step>6. discard. Stir butter and remaining 1/4 cup mustard in another small bowl. Using a pastry brush, thickly coat roast with mustard-butter sauce. Coat with remaining 2 Tbsp. steak seasoning. Roast beef until a brown crust forms, 5-10 minutes. Transfer to a cutting board and carve. Serve with sour cream sauce alongside.</step>
    <step>7. Sour cream sauce can be made 1 day ahead. Transfer to an airtight container and chill.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Sour Cream Apple Pie</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['Pastry dough'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 large eggs'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 cups sour cream'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/3 cups sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons plus 1/3 cup all-purpose flour'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 pound granny Smith apples'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon cinnamon'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 stick (1/4 cup) cold unsalted butter</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cut into 1/2-inch cubes']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Roll out dough on a lightly floured surface with a lightly floured rolling pin into a 13-inch round (1/8 inch thick), then fit into a 9-inch metal pie plate. Trim edge, leaving a 1/2-inch overhang, then fold overhang under and crimp edge decoratively. Chill shell 30 minutes.</step>
    <step>2. While shell chills, put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 400°F.</step>
    <step>3. Whisk together eggs, sour cream, vanilla, 1 cup sugar, 3 tablespoons flour, nutmeg, and salt in a bowl until smooth. Peel and core apples, then cut into wedges slightly less than 1/4 inch thick. Arrange apples in pie shell, then pour sour cream mixture evenly over them, coating all apples.</step>
    <step>4. Bake pie 15 minutes, then reduce oven temperature to 350°F and bake until filling is puffed and golden and apples are tender, 45 to 50 minutes.</step>
    <step>5. While pie bakes, stir together remaining 1/3 cup sugar, remaining 1/3 cup flour, cinnamon, and a pinch of salt in a bowl, then blend in butter with your fingertips until mixture forms small clumps.</step>
    <step>6. Remove pie from oven and increase oven temperature to 400°F. Crumble topping evenly over top and bake until sugar is melted, about 10 minutes. Cool pie on a rack at least 45 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Crab Cakes</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['2 slices firm white sandwich bread'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 pound jumbo lump crabmeat</ingredient>
    <ingredient>picked over'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoon mayonnaise'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 large egg</ingredient>
    <ingredient>beaten'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoon unsalted butter'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'lemon wedges']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Tear bread into small pieces into a bowl with crab. Add mayonnaise, Worcestershire sauce, 2 Tbsp egg (discard remainder), and a pinch of salt. Mix together gently but thoroughly, then form into 4 patties (about 3 inches in diameter).</step>
    <step>2. Heat butter in a 12-inch heavy skillet over medium heat until foam subsides, then cook crab cakes, turning once, until golden brown, about 6 minutes total.</step>
    <step>3. french fries and/or baby greens tossed with lemon vinaigrette.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Hoisin-Marinated Pork Chops</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 1/2 cups plus 2 tablespoons hoisin sauce'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup oyster sauce'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup black bean garlic sauce'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 garlic cloves</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon chopped peeled fresh ginger'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon red food coloring'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 12- to 14-ounce pork rib chops</ingredient>
    <ingredient>each about 1 1/2 inches thick']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Mix first 6 ingredients in large bowl for marinade. Place chops in extra-large resealable plastic bag. Add marinade to bag. Seal top, releasing excess air. Turn bag to coat chops. Refrigerate 3 to 5 days, turning bag occasionally.</step>
    <step>2. Preheat broiler, adjusting rack 8 inches below heat source. Line rimmed baking sheet with heavy-duty foil. Remove chops from marinade. Place chops on prepared pan with some marinade still clinging. Broil until chops are cooked through and thermometer inserted horizontally into center registers 145°F, watching closely to prevent burning (chops may char slightly in spots), about 9 minutes per side. Transfer to plates and serve.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>
